page.title: 08Mangrove Hall Farm
page.content: Mangrove Hall Farm is now a part of Lilley Bottom Farm. Mr.Andrews is the tenant farmer.He farms 200 acres of land,which really belongs to the Crown and is part of the Putteridge Estate. He pays rent to the Queen and she gives it to the Government.Mr.Andrews grows wheat,barley,oil seed rape and grass.He has 30 bullocks, six horses (3 of them are race-horses)2 geese and 4 dogs.It costs Â£200 a year to feed the bullocks.He fattens them up to sell for beef.It costs Â£1,040 a year to keep the race-horses and Â£520 a year for the ponies.The geese just have to scratch around and the dogs are fed on dog food and scraps.Mr. Andrews owns all sorts of machinery such as a combine harvester, pick-up baler, four tractors, two ploughs,one harrow and one sprayer, one hedge-cutter,one hay-thredder,one hay
